instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1369: What is A1369? A1369 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2010, Mid 2011 with EMC 2392, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2838, 820-3023..
definitions.820-3023: What is 820-3023? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.BKL_PWM: What is BKL_PWM? BKL_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight problem
threads.message: hello. have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with backlight problem.when flat cable of I/O board is discconected have backlight several seconds. whats should be problem? thanks

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight problem
threads.message: Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal first; w/ and w/o LIO board connected.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight problem
threads.message:
1) so. without LIO board connected <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> have 3v and backlight present after about 5-6 seconds backlight dont have but 3v still present.
2) withi LIO board connected always havr 1.1~1.3v and no backlight at all

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight problem
threads.message:
There is a problem with lid sensor, placed on LIO board.
Apart of that, some problem must be on the MLB too, if backlight disappears.

First, do PRAM reset 2-3 times.
If no change, check <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>/PWM.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight problem
threads.message:
what i tried already

1) pram reset
2) tried another lio board and flex cable

but nothing changed

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight problem
threads.message: to check <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> display must be connected yes ? and also lio board must be connected ?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight problem
threads.message:
so i tried like this

1) without LIO board connected <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL> have 2.6v and <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> have 3,3v. after several second backlight goes off and both voltages dropping to 0v 
2) with LIO board connected <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL> have 2.6v and <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> have 0v.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight problem
threads.message:
No need to connect LIO board.
In fact it has a problem and you will need to fix that too.

Did you test known good compatible LCD assembly?
You may need to change <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>.
Inspect its area for corrosion.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight problem
threads.message: yes i tested this lcd on another macbook and also another lcd on this macbook.  now i changed <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> and nothing changed. exactly same problem remained.there is not any corosion

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight problem
threads.message: Did you check with LIO board disconnected always?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight problem
threads.message: yes i checked lio boar disconnected also of course. very important thing what i missed to detect and write here. fisrt boot is normal have chime and fan is rotating normaly after several seconds fan stops rotating and macbook is like turned off but <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> have 8.4v. with and without LIO board is same only different is that without LIO board backlight working and we can see apple logo and loading bar after loading bar completes about 70% macbook is turning off. but <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> have 8.4v as i said. with LIO board connected also we have apple logo and loading bard and after 70% turning off. but no backlight with LIO board before its turning off.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight problem
threads.message: Just in case, try known good BIOS (clean ME).

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight problem
threads.message:
Get good LIO board/flex and test again.
Let see if beeps RAM error.

You can also run the corresponding ASD.
